intro: Tarenna cinerea, commonly known as the pale tarenna, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its pale green, often hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Tarenna cinerea is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
